Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL ?; PAINTED
Name: Bowl with decoration of flowers
Description: This beautiful bowl in clay is characterised by a floral decoration: on the lower framing two sorts of flowers with stems arise: the simplest are painted in red; the others, which take the form of a lotus, have a red stem and a flower of a brown colour. The piece, which is intact, comes from the excavations of F. Griffith in 1910.
